intro: Hepatica hepatica var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered liverwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped leaves and its early spring blooming habit. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically blue or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This variety is often found in the temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
